intro: Schoenocaulon officinale, commonly known as the mountain stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh alpine environments. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
